# haproxy-h2-header-length-poc

This is a PoC showing that when HaProxy talks to an Nginx in the backend header values longer than 4096 characters lead to a 502 response iff HTTP/2 is used between HaProxy and Nginx.

## Quickstart

Install Vagrant and VirtualBox and run
```bash
vagrant up
```

Now you have HaProxy on port 8080, Nginx via HTTP/1.1 on 8081 and Nginx via HTTP/2 on 8082.
http://localhost:8080/good leads to the HTTP/1.1 backend that can handle header value lengths above 4096 characters.
http://localhost:8080/bad leads to the HTTP/2 backend that can NOT handle header value lengths above 4096 characters.

To test this run
```bash
# should return 404
curl 'http://localhost:8080/bad' -H 'aaa: '

# same request but one character longer
curl 'http://localhost:8080/bad' -H 'aaa: '
```

The first returns 404 then second 502. 

Feel free to test this against http://localhost:8080/good or http://localhost:8081 or http://localhost:8082.
You will notice that all other endpoints work.

HaProxy outputs something like

```
10.0.2.2:57818 [21/Jul/2022:13:17:37.191] frontend bad/some_server 40/0/1/-1/41 502 209 - - SH-- 1/1/0/0/0 0/0 "GET /bad HTTP/1.1"
```

Nginx outputs something like

```
127.0.0.1 - - [21/Jul/2022:13:17:37 +0000] "-" 000 0 "-" "curl/7.81.0"
```

To look at the logs yourself run

```
vagrant ssh
sudo -i
less /var/log/nginx/access.log
journalctl -u haproxy
```
